# NetHack Utility-Generated Runtime Data Files

## Header Files (compile-time only, not runtime)
- [ ] `include/date.h` - `makedefs -V`
- [ ] `include/onames.h` - `makedefs -o`
- [ ] `include/pm.h` - `makedefs -p`
- [ ] `include/vis_tab.h` - `makedefs -z`
- [ ] `src/monstr.c` - `makedefs -m`
- [ ] `src/vis_tab.c` - `makedefs -z`

## Runtime Data Files (must be in nethackdir)

### Generated by makedefs
Each makedefs run is independent. Input files must be copied to pyrv32_sim_fs/dat/ before running.

- [x] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/data` - `makedefs -d` 
  - Input: `data.base`
  - Output: `data` (205KB, 53.6M instructions)
  
- [x] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/rumors` - `makedefs -r`
  - Input: `rumors.tru`, `rumors.fal`
  - Output: `rumors` (42KB, 6.1M instructions)
  
- [x] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/oracles` - `makedefs -h`
  - Input: `oracles.txt`
  - Output: `oracles` (5.9KB, 1.7M instructions)
  
- [x] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/quest.dat` - `makedefs -q`
  - Input: `quest.txt`
  - Output: `quest.dat` (95KB, 24.3M instructions)
  
- [x] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/options` - `makedefs -v`
  - Input: none (compile-time config)
  - Output: `options` (573 bytes, 118K instructions)
  
### Generated by dgn_comp (via makedefs -e first)
- [x] `dat/dungeon.pdf` - `makedefs -e` (intermediate)
  - Input: `dungeon.def`
  - Output: `dungeon.pdf` (2,199 bytes, 491K instructions)
  
- [x] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/dungeon` - `dgn_comp dungeon.pdf`
  - Input: `dungeon.pdf`
  - Output: `dungeon` (2,492 bytes, 628K instructions)

### Generated by lev_comp - Special Levels (11 .des → ~48 .lev)
Each .des file can produce multiple .lev files. Input .des files must be in pyrv32_sim_fs/dat/.

- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/bigrm-1.lev` through `bigrm-5.lev` - `lev_comp bigroom.des` (5 levels)
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/castle.lev` - `lev_comp castle.des` (1 level)
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/astral.lev`, `air.lev`, `earth.lev`, `fire.lev`, `water.lev` - `lev_comp endgame.des` (5 levels)
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/asmodeus.lev`, `baalz.lev`, `fakewiz1.lev`, `fakewiz2.lev`, `juiblex.lev`, `orcus.lev`, `sanctum.lev`, `valley.lev`, `wizard1.lev`, `wizard2.lev`, `wizard3.lev` - `lev_comp gehennom.des` (11 levels)
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/knox.lev` - `lev_comp knox.des` (1 level)
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/medusa-1.lev`, `medusa-2.lev` - `lev_comp medusa.des` (2 levels)
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/minefill.lev`, `minend-1.lev` through `minend-3.lev`, `minetn-1.lev` through `minetn-7.lev` - `lev_comp mines.des` (11 levels)
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/oracle.lev` - `lev_comp oracle.des` (1 level)
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/soko1-1.lev`, `soko1-2.lev`, `soko2-1.lev`, `soko2-2.lev`, `soko3-1.lev`, `soko3-2.lev`, `soko4-1.lev`, `soko4-2.lev` - `lev_comp sokoban.des` (8 levels)
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/tower1.lev`, `tower2.lev`, `tower3.lev` - `lev_comp tower.des` (3 levels)

### Generated by lev_comp - Quest Levels (13 roles × 5 levels = 65 .lev)
Each role .des file produces 5 levels: strt, loca, fila, filb, goal

- [ ] `Arc-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Arch.des`
- [ ] `Bar-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Barb.des`
- [ ] `Cav-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Caveman.des`
- [ ] `Hea-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Healer.des`
- [ ] `Kni-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Knight.des`
- [ ] `Mon-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Monk.des`
- [ ] `Pri-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Priest.des`
- [ ] `Ran-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Ranger.des`
- [ ] `Rog-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Rogue.des`
- [ ] `Sam-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Samurai.des`
- [ ] `Tou-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Tourist.des`
- [ ] `Val-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Valkyrie.des`
- [ ] `Wiz-*.lev` (5 levels) - `lev_comp Wizard.des`

### Static Runtime Files (already exist, just copy)
Copy from nethack-3.4.3/dat/ to nethack_datafiles/usr/games/lib/nethackdir/

- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/cmdhelp`
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/help`
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/hh`
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/history`
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/license`
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/opthelp`
- [ ] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/wizhelp`

### Runtime State Files (created empty by game)
These are created at pyrv32_sim_fs/usr/games/lib/nethackdir/ for NetHack to write to.

- [x] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/perm`
- [x] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/record`
- [x] `usr/games/lib/nethackdir/logfile`

---

## Workflow Notes

### Clean Generation Pattern
Each utility run should start with a clean pyrv32_sim_fs/dat/:
1. Remove all files from pyrv32_sim_fs/dat/
2. Copy only required input files from nethack-3.4.3/dat/
3. Run utility in simulator
4. Verify output file(s) created
5. Archive output to nethack_datafiles/usr/games/lib/nethackdir/
6. Verify archived files

This ensures each generation is independent and reproducible.
